intro: Dennstaedtia terminalis, commonly known as the fernlet, is a small, delicate fern native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that remain throughout the year. The plant has a rhizomatous growth habit, with short, horizontal stems that produce new shoots from the base. Its leaves are typically triangular in shape and have a distinctive, serrated margin. Dennstaedtia terminalis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
